message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Of the options given, Cyclophosphamide is most commonly associated with urinary symptoms such as hematuria and urinary frequency. It is known to cause bladder irritation and hemorrhagic cystitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cyclophosphamide is known to cause bladder toxicity, which can result in blood in the urine and lower abdominal pain, as well as urinary frequency and urgency. The other medications listed are not typically associated with these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the chemotherapy options listed, Cyclophosphamide can cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which can result in blood in the urine and lower abdominal pain. The other options do not typically cause these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cyclophosphamide is known to cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which can lead to blood in the urine and lower abdominal pain. Rituximab is not associated with these symptoms. Methotrexate and prednisone can cause other side effects, but not specifically related to urinary symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cyclophosphamide is known to cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which can lead to blood in the urine and lower abdominal pain. Methotrexate, Rituximab, and Prednisone are not known to cause this specific symptom.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only cyclophosphamide is known to cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which can result in blood in urine and lower abdominal pain. It can also cause urinary urgency and frequency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cyclophosphamide can cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which presents with blood in the urine and lower abdominal pain. Methotrexate can cause renal dysfunction, but not the specific symptoms described by the patient. Rituximab and prednisone are not known to cause these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cyclophosphamide is known to cause bladder toxicity and can lead to symptoms such as hematuria, abdominal pain, and urinary urgency and frequency. Methotrexate is associated with nephrotoxicity, but not specifically bladder toxicity. Rituximab and prednisone are not known to cause bladder toxicity as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Of the options given, Cyclophosphamide is known for its bladder irritant effect, which can cause blood in urine, urinary frequency, and urgency. Rituximab, Methotrexate, and Prednisone do not have this effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Of the options, Cyclophosphamide is known to cause hemorrhagic cystitis, which can present with blood in urine, lower abdominal pain, and urinary frequency and urgency.
